div.script: components.addItem("unifiedPublishingAlert");

div.div: We educate all students to be college, career, and community ready, inspired to succeed in our diverse world.
A special distribution of weekend meals will take place April 17 and 24.
The District is closely monitoring events surrounding the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19).

a.title: Parents: Sign Up for Text Alerts
a.span: Parents: Sign Up for Text Alerts

div.div: A reminder to parents to sign up for text alerts if desired.
Free breakfast and lunch available for children beginning March 23.
Board of Education will move to offer the position of superintendent of schools and learning.
We are thrilled to recognize six students and teachers as winners of the 2020 Herb Kohl Educational Foundation Awards.
The open enrollment window for 2020-21 is February 3-April 30, 2020.
Enrollment is open for Head Start or 4K for the 2020-21 school year.

a.title: District and School State Report Cards Show Positive Trend
a.span: District and School State Report Cards Show Positive Trend

div.div: The District and 23 District schools made significant improvements.
The Task Force has been reviewing the emerging research on school start times.

div.div: Redesign 2020
February 28, 2020
The Board of Education held a retreat to discuss solutions to inequities in enrollment and facilities across the District.

div.div: RIGHT Up Program Rewards Good Bus Behavior
February 13, 2020
The District's Transportation Department developed the RIGHT Up program to reward students for positive behavior on the school bus.

a.aria-label: Read More AboutStudent Earns 36 Credits for College Education

div.div: Student Earns 36 Credits for College Education
February 07, 2020
Krysten Capwell's dream is to become a nurse anesthetist, and at only 17 years old, she is well on her way to achieving that goal.

h1.a: green bay area public school district

div.p: 200 South Broadway, Green Bay, Wisconsin 54303 | Phone: 920-448-2000 | Fax: 920-448-3562

p.small: The Green Bay Area Public School District does not discriminate against a person's sex, race, religion, national origin, ancestry, creed, pregnancy, marital or parental status, sexual orientation or physical, mental, emotional or learning disability. - Wis. Stat. Sec. 118.13

If you cannot fully access the information on any web page of this site, please let us know the accessibility issue you are having by calling (920) 448-2025, or by email at communications@gbaps.org. We will try to provide the information to you in an alternative format and/or make the necessary improvements to make the information accessible.
